Marie Losier (b.France, 1972), is a filmmaker and curator who’s worked in New York City for 23 years and has shown her films and videos at museums, galleries, biennials and festivals. Losier studied literature at the University of Nanterre (France, BA, 1995) and Fine Arts at Hunter College, City University of New York (MFA, 2003). She has made a number of film portraits on avant-garde directors, musicians and composers, such as the Kuchar brothers, Guy Maddin, Richard Foreman, Tony Conrad, Genesis P-Orridge, Alan Vega, Peter Hristoff, Peaches and Felix Kubin. Whimsical, poetic, dreamlike and unconventional, her films explore the life and work of these artists.

Losier’s films are shown at prestigious venues such as The Cannes Film Festival, Le Jeu de Paume, The Berlinale, Rotterdam Film Festival, IDFA , The Tate Modern, MoMA, Le Palais de Tokyo, Le Centre Georges Pompidou and La Cinémathèque Francaise. She was included in the 2006 Whitney Biennial (Whitney Museum, N.Y.C). She had a retrospective of her films at MoMA - Museum of Modern Art in 2018 in NYC, and a retrospective at Le Jeu De Paume - the Museum of Contemporary Art in Paris in 2019.

Losier’s first feature film was a portrait of pioneering musician-artist Genesis Breyer P-Orridge (of Throbbing Gristle and Psychic TV) and their partner Lady Jaye. The Ballad of Genesis and Lady Jaye premiered at the Berlin Film Festival in February 2011, winning the Caligary and the Teddy Awards. She also won the Grand Prize at Indielisboa, the Prix Louis Marcorelles and the Prix des Bibliothèques at Cinéma du Réel; the film was released in France, Canada, Mexico, Germany and in the USA.

In 2013/14 Losier was awarded the prestigious DAAD Residency Award in Berlin and the Guggenheim Award to work on her new feature film Cassandro The Exotico!, a portrait of the celebrated Mexican wrestler Saul Almendariz. Cassandro The Exotico! produced by Tamara Films, premiered at The Cannes Film Festival in May of 2018 (ACID CANNES). It was released in France in 2018 and in 2019 in the US (it premiered at the Metrograph NYC). www.urbandistribution.fr/films/cassandro-the-exotico

Losier had a mid-career retrospective at MoMA in New York City and all of her films were acquired for the museum’s archives in November of 2018.

She premiered a new film at Locarno International Film Festival in Switzerland in August 2019: a feature film on the German composer and musician, Felix Kubin (Felix in Wonderland!). The Film was produced by Ecce Films.

She presented a mid career retrospective for the Museum Le Jeu de Paume, Paris (www.jeudepaume.org) in November 2019 and for the Cinematheque of Athens (November 2019); She had an exhibition, in collaboration with Pauline Curnier Jardin, for the Fondation Ricard for May 2019 (www.fondation-entreprise-ricard.com), a solo exhibition for Anne Barrault’s contemporary art gallery in Paris, where she exhibited photography, paintings and film installations (January 2020 + 2023) (www.galerieannebarrault.com). She just had a solo show at the Film Gallery in Paris (nov-dec 2021) and at The Solar Gallery in Vila Do Conde in Portugal for 2022. She is now showing in a group show at the Mac Val Museum (Histoires Vraies 2023).

She had a solo show at the FIAF Galery of Phnom Penh/Cambodge for January 2024, and is preparing a new exhibition at Le Creux de L’Enfer in Thiers for October 2024, and at the Contemporary Museum/Transpalette in Bourges for 2025.

She has been working on a film portrait for now 6 years on the band THE RESIDENTS, SKYZO IN LIMBO from San Francisco, produced by Barberousse Films.

After 17 years in the making, she just finished her film portrait on the singer-performer, Peaches, PEACHES GOES BANANAS, a film co-produced by Tamara Films in Paris and Michigan Film in Bruxelles.

The film will premiere at the MOSTRA in Venice (2024).

She is also developing with her co-writer Antoine Barraud, her first fiction feature, a Musical, SUGAR BOMB, produced by Tamara Films and Kidam.

For the past eight years Losier has been teaching film at the MFA cinema students at LA HEAD in Geneva, Switzerland (Haute École d’Art et de Design à Genève, www.hesge.ch/head/en/school/about) where she teaches 16mm filmmaking and Foley Art).

A catalogue/publication on her work has just been printed from publisher SEMIOSE: Please To Meet You Marie Losier (Preface Nicole Brenez et Constance Dejong)
